titleStmt.title: Hear, o Earth, ye earthen men and women the Heavens have given fire to lighten the Cabbal in man; and a voice from that enlightendment shall be declared from the Lords tent, standing in the bounds of Eltham, called by name, the middle park. ...
titleStmt.author: Tany, Thomas, fl. 1649-1655.

titleStmt.title: Hear, o Earth, ye earthen men and women the Heavens have given fire to lighten the Cabbal in man; and a voice from that enlightendment shall be declared from the Lords tent, standing in the bounds of Eltham, called by name, the middle park. ...
titleStmt.author: Tany, Thomas, fl. 1649-1655.

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: TheauRam Taniah, leader of the people. Named, Theauraujohn. Called, Thomas Totni, gold-smith, at the three golden lions without Temple-bar. (i.e. Thomas Tany).
Title from opening lines of text.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
